subject: Investing
title: Home Equity Lines of Credit for Investors
description: A micro-lesson that makes Home Equity Lines of Credit for Investors usable.

hook.text: An investor used a $80,000 HELOC on her primary home to fund the down payment on rental number three.

buildup.text: A HELOC lets you borrow against equity you've already built in a property you own.

discovery.text: HELOCs offer revolving credit at variable rates, so you only pay interest on what you draw.

twist.text: If rates spike or the rental underperforms, you're servicing two debts on a single income stream.

climax.text: Used wisely, HELOCs accelerate portfolio growth. Used carelessly, they stack dangerous debt.

punchline.text: A HELOC is rocket fuel: powerful in the right hands, explosive in the wrong ones.

quiz.question: What does a HELOC allow you to borrow against?
